intro: Pavetta iringensis, commonly known as the Iringa pavetta, is a shrub native to eastern Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded habitats such as forest understories. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often have a velvety texture. Pavetta iringensis produces small, white to pale yellow flowers followed by capsule fruits containing numerous seeds.
